bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite this Act, the Provincial Sales Tax Act or any other Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting any matter that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers is not provided for, or is not sufficiently provided for, in this Act or the Provincial Sales Tax Act;
making provisions that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers appropriate for the purpose of more effectively bringing this Act and the Provincial Sales Tax Act into operation;

making provisions that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers appropriate for the purpose of preventing, minimizing or otherwise addressing any transitional difficulties encountered in bringing this Act or the Provincial Sales Tax Act into effect, including, without limitation, provisions making an exception to or a modification of a provision in an enactment or providing for the application or continued application of a previous enactment;
resolving any errors, inconsistencies or ambiguities arising in this Act or the Provincial Sales Tax Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A regulation under subsection (1) may be made retroactive to April 1, 2013 or a later date, and if made retroactive is deemed to have come into force on the specified date.
To the extent of any conflict between a regulation under subsection (1) and another enactment, the regulation prevails.
This section and any regulations made under this section are repealed on April 1, 2016.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite this Act, the Motor Fuel Tax Act or any other Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting any matter that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers is not provided for, or is not sufficiently provided for, by the amendments to the Motor Fuel Tax Act made by this Act;

resolving any errors, inconsistencies or ambiguities arising from the amendments to the Motor Fuel Tax Act made by this Act.
